about.name: Hong Kong
about.info_text: Hong Kong is a bustling metropolis and Special Administrative Region of China, known for its stunning skyline, vibrant culture, and rich history. Situated on the southeast coast of China, Hong Kong is a dynamic city that seamlessly blends tradition and modernity. It's famous for its impressive skyscrapers, bustling street markets, delicious cuisine, and picturesque harbors. Visitors can explore a wide range of attractions, from traditional temples to high-end shopping districts.
about.facts_text:
Population: Over 7 million
Region: Hong Kong SAR
Time Zone: Hong Kong Time (UTC+08:00)
Languages: Chinese (Cantonese) and English
Currency: Hong Kong Dollar (HKD)
about.climate_text: Hong Kong has a subtropical climate with distinct seasons. Summers are hot and humid, while winters are mild and dry. Typhoons can occasionally affect the region during the summer months.

attractions_card.title: Victoria Peak
attractions_card.description: Victoria Peak offers panoramic views of Hong Kong's iconic skyline. Visitors can take the Peak Tram to the summit and enjoy the stunning vistas.

attractions_card.title: Star Ferry
attractions_card.description: The Star Ferry is an iconic Hong Kong experience, offering scenic harbor cruises between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

attractions_card.title: Tian Tan Buddha
attractions_card.description: The Tian Tan Buddha, located on Lantau Island, is one of the world's largest outdoor seated bronze Buddhas and is a significant religious site.

attractions_card.title: Hong Kong Disneyland
attractions_card.description: Families can enjoy a magical day at Hong Kong Disneyland, with attractions, parades, and the enchanting Sleeping Beauty Castle.

attractions_card.title: Temple Street Night Market
attractions_card.description: Temple Street Night Market is a bustling market in Kowloon, offering a wide variety of street food, souvenirs, and bargain shopping.

attractions_card.title: Wong Tai Sin Temple
attractions_card.description: Wong Tai Sin Temple is a Taoist temple where visitors can experience traditional Chinese rituals, fortune telling, and cultural practices.

attractions_card.title: Ocean Park
attractions_card.description: Ocean Park is an oceanarium and theme park that combines marine life, animal exhibits, and thrilling rides for a fun-filled day.

attractions_card.title: Avenue of Stars
attractions_card.description: The Avenue of Stars along the Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront honors Hong Kong's film industry and offers fantastic views of the harbor and cityscape.

food_card.title: Dim Sum
food_card.description: Dim Sum is a popular style of Cantonese cuisine, featuring bite-sized dishes such as dumplings, buns, and rolls, often served with tea.

food_card.title: Char Siu
food_card.description: Char Siu is a delicious barbecue pork dish, known for its sweet and savory flavor, often served with rice or in buns.

food_card.title: Wonton Noodles
food_card.description: Wonton noodles are a classic Hong Kong comfort food, featuring plump wontons and egg noodles in a savory broth.

food_card.title: Roast Goose
food_card.description: Roast goose is a flavorful and tender dish, often served with a crispy skin and accompanied by a delicious sauce.

food_card.title: Egg Tarts
food_card.description: Egg tarts are a beloved dessert in Hong Kong, featuring flaky pastry and a creamy, sweet custard filling.

hotels_card.title: The Peninsula Hong Kong
hotels_card.description: The Peninsula Hong Kong is a legendary luxury hotel with a history dating back to 1928, offering opulent accommodations and top-notch service.

hotels_card.title: Ritz-Carlton Hong Kong
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton is a five-star hotel located in the International Commerce Centre, featuring breathtaking views, luxurious rooms, and exquisite dining.

hotels_card.title: Island Shangri-La Hong Kong
hotels_card.description: The Island Shangri-La offers elegance and comfort in the heart of Hong Kong, with stunning views, a Horizon Club, and fine dining.

hotels_card.title: Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong
hotels_card.description: The Mandarin Oriental is a five-star hotel with a central location, luxurious rooms, and a range of dining options, including Michelin-starred restaurants.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Hong Kong
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons Hotel offers world-class luxury, stunning harbor views, and impeccable service in the heart of the city.

transport_card.title: Hong Kong MTR
transport_card.description: The Hong Kong MTR (Mass Transit Railway) is a convenient and efficient subway system connecting various parts of the city, including Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

transport_card.title: Trams
transport_card.description: The iconic trams in Hong Kong are a charming way to explore the city's streets and offer scenic views of daily life.

transport_card.title: Star Ferry
transport_card.description: The Star Ferry provides a picturesque way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, offering views of the skyline and harbor.

transport_card.title: Hong Kong International Airport
transport_card.description: Hong Kong International Airport (HKG) is a major international airport that connects Hong Kong with destinations around the world.
